XMLIndata Class Reference

Handles processing of XML data controlling generation process in GenerateMapServer. More...

Detailed Description

Handles processing of XML data controlling generation process in GenerateMapServer.

Definition at line 35 of file XMLIndata.h.

Each element contain the map supplier and the countires one of its coverage bounding boxes covers.

Member Function Documentation

XMLParserHelper* XMLIndata::createXMLParserHelper (  const set< const char * > &  xmlFiles  )  [static, private]
 

Loads map generation XML files, allocates an XMLParserHelper with new and inits the XMLParserHelper with the XML files.

Use deleteXMLParserHelper to delete a parser created from this one.

Parameters:
xmlFiles The xml files to parse. NB not all kinds of XML files are supported.
Returns:
A XMLParserHelper that must be deleted after usage.

bool XMLIndata::parseAddRegion (  const DOMNode *  addRegion,
NameCollection &  regionNames,
TopRegionMatch::topRegion_t &  regionType,
MC2String &  regionIdent,
multimap< MC2String, ItemIdentifier * > &  contents,
set< MC2String > &  insideRegions
)  [static]
 

Parse add_region xml node.

Note that the ItemIdentifiers in contents must be deleted by the caller of this method.

Parameters:
addRegion The add_region node.
regionNames Out parameter. The names of the region.
regionType Out parameter. The region type.
regionIdent Out parameter. The region ident.
contents Out parameter. Multimap containing the contents of the region. The map id is key and an item identifier is value. If the item identifier is NULL, then that means that all of the map is inside the region. If not NULL, only the corresponding item is inside the region. Note that the ItemIdentifiers are allocated here and must be deleted by the caller of this method.
insideRegions Out parameter. Which regions that this region is part of.
Returns:
True if the parsing went well, otherwise false.

void XMLIndata::parseAndAddMapSupCoverageToIndex (  MapIndex &  mapIndex,
const char *  xmlFileName
)  [static]
 

void XMLIndata::parseAndAddMapSupNamesToIndex (  MapIndex &  mapIndex,
const char *  mapSupNameXmlFile
)  [static]
 

void XMLIndata::parseAndAddRegionsToIndex (  MapIndex &  mapIndex,
const set< const char * > &  xmlFiles
)  [static]
 

Make sure to initiate the XML system (XMLPlatformUtils::Initialize) before calling this method.

Parse regions from XML files and adds them to mapIndex.

Parameters:
xmlFiles The XML files where the regions to add can be found, and the XML file containing the region IDs.

MC2BoundingBox XMLIndata::parseBoundingBox (  const DOMNode *  bBoxTopNode  )  [static, private]
 

Parse a bounding box as defined in map_generation-mc2.dtd from XML.

Parameters:
bBoxTopNode The top element of a bounding box.
Returns:
The bounding box defined by the bBoxTopNode element.

bool XMLIndata::parseContent (  const DOMNode *  content,
multimap< MC2String, ItemIdentifier * > &  contents
)  [static, private]
 

Parse content xml node.

Parameters:
content The content node.
contents Out parameter. Multimap containing the contents of the region. The map id is key and an item identifier is value. If the item identifier is NULL, then that means that all of the map is inside the region. If not NULL, only the corresponding item is inside the region. Note that the ItemIdentifiers are allocated here and must be deleted by the caller of this method.
Returns:
True if the parsing went well, otherwise false.

set<StringTable::countryCode> XMLIndata::parseCountryList (  const DOMNode *  cntrListTopNode  )  [static, private]
 

Parse a country list as defined in map_generation-mc2.dtd from XML.

Parameters:
cntrListTopNode The top element of a country list.
Returns:
The country list cntrListTopNode element.

bool XMLIndata::parseCreateOverview (  const DOMNode *  createOverview,
map< MC2String, MC2String > &  overviewByUnderview
)  [static]
 

Parse create_overview xml node.

Used by overview map creation and XMLIndata::parseCreateOverviewXMLData

Parameters:
createOverview The create_overview node.
overviewByUnderview Out parameter. Map containing overview map idents as value and underview map idents as key.
Returns:
True if the parsing went well, otherwise false.

map<MC2String, MC2String> XMLIndata::parseCreateOverviewXMLData (  const set< const char * > &  xmlFiles  )  [static]
 

Make sure to initiate the XML system (XMLPlatformUtils::Initialize) before calling this method.

Returns:
Map with higher level map names by lower level map names.
When parsing *_co.xml files, lower level are underview maps and higher are overview maps. When parsing *_coo.xml files, lower level are overview maps and higher level are super overview maps.

bool XMLIndata::parseItemIdent (  const DOMNode *  node,
ItemIdentifier &  itemIdent
)  [static, private]
 

Parse item_ident xml node.

Parameters:
node The item_ident node.
itemIdent Out parameter. The item ident (describes an item without specifying item id).
Returns:
True if the parsing went well, otherwise false.

void XMLIndata::parseMapSupCoverage (  const DOMNode *  mapSupCovNode,
uint32  parentSupIdx,
int32  parentHierarchyLevel,
MapModuleNoticeContainer::mapSupCoverage_t &  mapSupCov,
mapSupAndCountries_t &  supAndCntrListVec,
vector< vector< pair< uint32, uint32 > > > &  coverageTree
)  [static, private]
 

Parse a map supplier coverage as defined in map_generation-mc2.dtd from XML.

Parameters:
mapSupCovNode Top node of the map_suppler_coverage node to parse.
parentSupIdx Give the index of the parent map supplier element in the mapSupCov vector.
parentHierarchyLevel The level of nested map supplier coverage XML element of the parent. Start with -1 to make the first parsed end up on 0.
mapSupCov Bounding boxes mapped to map supplier.
supAndCntrListVec Countries covered by each map supplier area.
covTreeByLevel Vector of vectors with hierarchy of supplier boundig boxes. Index in outer vector determines level in the xml hierarchy. Second vector is ordered by the order to test the bounding boxes. The pair keeps parent idx in first and child idx in second. The idx:es correspond to the ones in mapSupCov.

void XMLIndata::parseMapSupName (  DOMNode *  mapSupNameNode,
MapModuleNoticeContainer::mapSupNamesByMapSup_t &  mapSupNames
)  [static, private]
 

Parse map suppler name XML element of one map supplier.

Parameters:
mapSupNameElm The DOMNode to parse
mapSupNames The names are stored here.

bool XMLIndata::parseName (  const DOMNode *  name,
NameCollection &  names
)  [static, private]
 

Parse name xml node.

Parameters:
name The name node.
names Out parameter. The names.
Returns:
True if the parsing went well, otherwise false.

bool XMLIndata::parseRegionIDs (  const DOMNode *  regionIDs,
map< MC2String, uint32 > &  regionIDsByIdent
)  [static, private]
